Title: Finding monotone patterns in sublinear time
Source: Proc. Annu. IEEE Symp. Found. Comput. Sci. FOCS
Abstract: © 2019 IEEE.We study the problem of finding monotone subsequences in an array from the viewpoint of sublinear algorithms. For fixed k N and ϵ > 0, we show that the non-Adaptive query complexity of finding a length-k monotone subsequence of f : [n] → R, assuming that f is ϵ-far from free of such subsequences, is Θ((log n) âŠlog-2kâ ). Prior to our work, the best algorithm for this problem, due to Newman, Rabinovich, Rajendraprasad, and Sohler (2017), made (log n)O(k2) non-Adaptive queries; and the only lower bound known, of Ω(log n) queries for the case k = 2, followed from that on testing monotonicity due to Ergün, Kannan, Kumar, Rubinfeld, and Viswanathan (2000) and Fischer (2004).
